metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2424 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3 isaffected. Safari before 10.1 is affected. The issue involves mishandling ofOpenGL shaders in the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers toobtain sensitive information from process memory via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
